hostNotes.text:
Welcome.

I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on opening up to our feelings with acceptance and intentionally choosing our actions.

We’ll be doing a short intro, then reflect on our own and share with each other. 

And a heads up that you will need pen and paper during the exercise.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words.

X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

image.description: When BUT gets in the way

hostNotes.text:
When we have difficult things going on inside, it is common to put our lives on hold. Wait for the difficult things to go away, and then we can get started with our lives again. That can put us in a position where we wait, and wait.

*I'll go to the gym another day when I’m not so tired.* 

*I'll see a friend some other time when I’m not so stressed.*
One of the things that affect how we deal with inner obstacles in life is language. How we talk to ourselves can impact how we behave. And one word we often use is the word **BUT**, as a condition.

content.heading: I would like to X, but I am so Y

hostNotes.text:
Now we’ll take a minute to reflect on our own. For this step you’ll need a piece of paper.

Most of us have recurring thoughts like *“ want to do x, **BUT** I am so y.* It can make us feel like we need to get rid of y, before we do x.

See if you can find one or two recent thoughts that contains something you want, but don’t do for a reason on the inside. Write them down. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s one minute. Let’s move on.

The next step is to replace your **BUT** with an **AND** in your sentences. 

Then read them out loud for yourself. 

What happens to them, and to you, when you do that?

1 minute starting now.

> Push play to start the timer.

That’s one minute. Let’s move on.

content.heading: What happened when you switched to AND?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one.
>
> Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing. 

Thank you everyone.

Well done. When we wait for unwanted feelings to go away so that we can do the things we want, we tend to put our lives on hold. Sometimes for a very long time. A more helpful strategy can be to open up to our feelings with acceptance, and intentionally choose our actions.

This can allow us to spend time and energy on the things that are important to us – even when they come with difficult emotions. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

For the coming three days, see if you can notice when you talk to yourself with “I want to do x, BUT I’m so y”-sentences. When you do, replace your BUTs with ANDs and see if you notice any difference in how you behave.

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.
> Start the session when you're ready to go.
